formatDescription:
XML Schemas Definition files define the structure, and content of XML documents. They are used to express a set of rules to which an XML document must conform in order to be considered 'valid' in accordance to the particular schema referenced.
Full specifications can be found at http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-0/
provenanceCompoundName: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

internalSignatures.name: XML Schema Definition
internalSignatures.note: ASCII header: <?xml version="1.0". ASCII footer: </xsd:schema> or </xs:schema> or </schema>. Signature will only identify against xsd files which do not have any comments inserted either before the xml declaration, or at the very end of the file.
